question: This video game, set in the American West in 1911, follows the story of John Marston, a former outlaw forced to hunt down his old gang members to protect his family.  The game's open world environment allows players to explore vast landscapes, from snow-capped mountains to arid deserts, encountering wildlife and engaging in various activities like hunting, gambling, and bounty hunting.  Its sequel, released in 2018, delves into the gang's backstory and features a new protagonist, Arthur Morgan.  What is the name of this critically acclaimed Western-themed action-adventure game developed by Rockstar Games?

This film, set in a dystopian future Britain ruled by a totalitarian regime, features a masked vigilante who blows up the Houses of Parliament on November 5th, a date commemorating the historical Gunpowder Plot. The film's protagonist played by Hugo Weaving, is a skilled swordsman and master of disguise who seeks to overthrow the oppressive government. The film's iconic Guy Fawkes mask, worn by V, has become a symbol of rebellion and anti-establishment movements worldwide. What is the title of this 2005 film, based on the graphic novel by Alan Moore and David Lloyd?

This franchise's iconic mascot, Pikachu, an electric mouse known for its lightning bolt-shaped tail, has become a global phenomenon, appearing in countless merchandise and spin-offs. Its first video game installments, Red and Green, were released in Japan in 1996 for the Game Boy, introducing the core gameplay mechanics of catching, training, and battling. The franchise has expanded to include a popular anime series, trading cards, toys, and numerous other products. What is the name of this multimedia franchise, centered around fictional creatures with unique abilities and elemental powers?

This epic fantasy trilogy's fictional language, Quenya, was created by their author, a philologist and professor of Anglo-Saxon. The One Ring, an artifact of immense power, bears the inscription of Black Speech that translates to "One ring to rule them all, one ring to find them, one ring to bring them all and in the darkness bind them." The story follows the hobbit Frodo Baggins on his quest to destroy the One Ring, an artifact of immense power coveted by the Dark Lord Sauron. What is the title of this fantasy epic, which has been adapted into award-winning films directed by Peter Jackson?

This fantasy series' protagonist, whose middle name is James, shares his birthday with his creator, July 31st.  The series' iconic villain whose name is an anagram for "Tom Marvolo Riddle," fears death and seeks immortality through dark magic.  The series' magical creatures, like house-elves and hippogriffs, are inspired by folklore and mythology.  What is the name of this beloved series, which follows a young wizard's journey through Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry?

This romantic comedy features a memorable scene in a crowded deli, leading to the iconic line, "I'll have what she's having." The film's central question, "Can men and women ever just be friends?", is explored through the evolving relationship between Harry Burns and Sally Albright. The film's soundtrack, featuring classic jazz standards by Harry Connick Jr., adds to its romantic and nostalgic atmosphere. What is the title of this 1989 film directed by Rob Reiner?

This classic Thanksgiving comedy features a memorable scene where the two main characters, stuck sharing a cramped motel room with only one double bed, end up sleeping head-to-toe in an awkward embrace. The film's mismatched duo, Neal Page, a high-strung businessman, and Del Griffith, a boisterous shower curtain ring salesman, endure a series of misadventures as they try to get home for the holiday.  Their disastrous journey involves a rental car that catches fire, a stolen car that gets towed, and a train ride with uncomfortable seating arrangements. What is the title of this 1987 film directed by John Hughes?
